definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To stop working on a permanent basis, usually because of old age or illness.
examples: Having made a large fortune, he retired .
She decided to retire from her banking job due to stress.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , sports ) To stop playing their sport and in competitions a sports player.
examples: I have decided to retire from football at the end of the season after the World Cup.
I have decided to retire from test cricket at 45.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , sometimes reflexive ) To withdraw ; to take away.
( transitive ) To cease use or production of something.
examples: The steamship made thousands of trips over several decades before it was retired by the shipping company.
When a hurricane becomes so deadly or destructive that future use would be insensitive, officials may retire the name of the hurricane.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To withdraw from circulation , or from the market ; to take up and pay.
examples: The central bank retired those notes five years ago.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause to retire; specifically, to designate as no longer qualified for active service; to place on the retired list.
examples: The board retired the old major.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , cricket , of a batsman ) To voluntarily stop batting before being dismissed so that the next batsman can bat .
examples: Jones retired in favour of Smith.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , baseball , of a fielder ) To make a play which results in a runner or the batter being out, either by means of a put out , fly out or strikeout . Also, when such an event ends a team's turn at bat.
examples: Jones makes the catch for the third out, and that retires the side.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To go back or return; to withdraw or retreat, especially from public view; to go into privacy .
examples: I will retire to the study.
to retire from the public eye

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To retreat from action or danger; to withdraw for safety or pleasure.
examples: The regiment retired from the fray after the Major was killed.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To recede ; to fall or bend back.
examples: Past the point, the shore retires into a sequence of coves.
I will retire for the night.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To stop working on a permanent basis, usually because of old age or illness.

( transitive , sometimes reflexive ) To withdraw ; to take away.

definitions.definition: To fit (a vehicle) with new tires .

main_definition: ( transitive , American spelling ) To fit (a vehicle) with new tires .
